name: Nana's Southern Pickled Peaches
author: BLUEROWZE
summary: Old Southern favorite.  Great on picnics with cucumber sandwiches or at Sunday supper.
ingredients: 4 pounds fresh clingstone peaches, blanched and peeled
directions: Combine the sugar, vinegar and water in a large pot, and bring to a boil
Press one or two cloves into each peach, and place into the boiling syrup
Boil for 20 minutes, or until peaches are tender
Spoon peaches into sterile jars and top with liquid to 1/2 inch from the rim
Put one cinnamon stick into each jar
Wipe the rims with a clean dry cloth, and seal with lids and rings
Process in a hot water bath for 10 minutes to seal, or consult times recommended by your local extension
